title: Here's What NYSE Could Be Saying To The S&P 500
text:
New York Stock Exchange Index:S&P 500 Ratio

Is the New York Stock Exchange Index ( ) about to send the a new bearish message? It's entirely possible.

The NYSE has been much weaker than the S&P 500 for the past couple of years (see lower right ratio chart).

And the NYSE index actually peaked in January of 2018 at (1), creating a series of lower highs inside of this falling channel.

When it broke support at (2), it and the broad markets sold off hard.

The index is currently testing a key support level at (3) while remaining inside of the falling channel.

What this broad index does at this key test of support will send an important message to the broad markets heading into year's end.
description: Stocks Analysis by Chris Kimble covering: S&P 500, NYSE Composite. Read Chris Kimble's latest article on Investing.com
